com.stripe.stripeterminal

Class Terminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stripe.stripeterminal.Terminal

  • public class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object
    The Terminal is the top-level object for the Stripe Terminal SDK.

                                TerminalListener listener)
                         throws TerminalException
        Initializes a terminal for the given context. Uses the default LogLevel of NONE.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context of the running Android application
        tokenProvider - The ConnectionTokenProvider to use when a new token is needed
        listener - The TerminalListener to inform of events in the Terminal lifecycle
        Throws:
        TerminalException

      • getInstance

        public static Terminal getInstance()
        Returns the current instance of the Terminal object. This instance should have been initialized already by calling initTerminal(android.content.Context, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ConnectionTokenProvider, com.stripe.stripeterminal.TerminalListener).
        Returns:
        The Terminal object that provides the main point of interaction with the reader and the Stripe API

      • setTerminalListener

        public void setTerminalListener(TerminalListener listener)
        Sets the current implementation of TerminalListener. This will replace any previous TerminalListeners that have been registered.

      • cancelPaymentIntent

        public void cancelPaymentIntent(PaymentIntent intent,
                                PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Cancels a PaymentIntent. If the cancel request succeeds, PaymentIntentCallback.onSuccess(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent) will be called with the updated PaymentIntent object with status CANCELED. If the cancel request fails, ErrorCallback.onFailure(com.stripe.stripeterminal.TerminalException) will be called with an error. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments/refunds
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent to be canceled
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback that should be called upon completion

      • clearCachedCredentials

        public void clearCachedCredentials()
        Clears the current connection token, saved reader sessions, and any other cached credentials. You can use this method to switch accounts in your app, e.g. to switch between live and test Stripe API keys on your backend. In order to switch accounts in your app: - if a reader is connected, call disconnectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Callback) - call clearCachedCredentials() - call discoverReaders(com.stripe.stripeterminal.DiscoveryConfiguration, com.stripe.stripeterminal.DiscoveryListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.Callback) and connectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Reader, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderCallback) to connect to a reader. The connectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Reader, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderCallback) call will request a new connection token from your backend server. An overview of the lifecycle of a connection token under the hood: - When a Terminal is initialized, the SDK attempts to proactively request a connection token from your backend server. - When connectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Reader, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderCallback) is called, the SDK uses the connection token and reader information to create a reader session. - Subsequent calls to connectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Reader, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderCallback) require a new connection token. If you disconnect from a reader, and then call connectReader(com.stripe.stripeterminal.Reader, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderCallback) again, the SDK will fetch another connection token.

      • collectPaymentMethod

        public Cancelable collectPaymentMethod(PaymentIntent intent,
                                       ReaderDisplayListener listener,
                                       PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Collects a payment method for the given PaymentIntent. If collecting a payment method fails, the callback will be called with an error. After resolving the error, you may call collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderDisplayListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) again to either try the same card again, or try a different card. If collecting a payment method succeeds, the callback will be called with a PaymentIntent with status REQUIRES_CONFIRMATION, indicating that you should call processPayment(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) to finish the payment. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments#collect
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent to which the payment method should be attached
        listener - The ReaderDisplayListener to alert when reader events are triggered
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called after the command completes
        Returns:
        A Cancelable that allows the operation to be canceled at any time

      • connectReader

        public void connectReader(Reader reader,
                          ReaderCallback connectionCallback)
        Attempts to connect to the given reader. If the connect succeeds, the callback will be called with the connected reader, and the terminal's ConnectionStatus will change to CONNECTED. If the connect fails, the callback will be called with an error. Under the hood, the SDK uses the ConnectionTokenProvider.fetchConnectionToken(com.stripe.stripeterminal.ConnectionTokenCallback) method you defined to fetch a connection token if it does not already have one. It then uses the connection token and reader information to create a reader session. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/readers/connecting
        Parameters:
        reader - The Reader object to connect to.
        connectionCallback - The callback to be called when connection completes

      • createPaymentIntent

        public void createPaymentIntent(PaymentIntentParameters params,
                                PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Creates a new PaymentIntent with the given parameters. Note: If the information required to create a PaymentIntent isn't readily available in your app, you can create the PaymentIntent on your server and use the retrievePaymentIntent(java.lang.String, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) method to retrieve the PaymentIntent in your app. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments#create
        Parameters:
        params - The PaymentIntentParameters object with info about the intent to create
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called when creation completes

      • disconnectReader

        public void disconnectReader(Callback callback)
        Attempts to disconnect from the currently connected reader. If the disconnect succeeds, Callback.onSuccess() will be called. If the disconnect fails, the ErrorCallback.onFailure(com.stripe.stripeterminal.TerminalException) is called with an error. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/readers/connecting
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback that should be called after disconnection.

      • discoverReaders

        public Cancelable discoverReaders(DiscoveryConfiguration config,
                                  DiscoveryListener discoveryListener,
                                  Callback callback)
        Begins discovering readers matching the given DiscoveryConfiguration. When discoverReaders is called, the terminal begins scanning for readers using the settings in the given DiscoveryConfiguration. You must implement DiscoveryListener to handle displaying discovery results to your user and connecting to a selected reader. The discovery process will stop on its own when the terminal successfully connects to a reader, if the command is canceled, or if an error occurs. If the discovery process completes successfully, or if an error occurs, the Callback will be called to notify that the operation is complete. To end discovery after a specified time interval, set the timeout property on your DiscoveryConfiguration. Be sure to either set a timeout, or make it possible to cancel discover in your app's UI. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/readers/connecting
        Parameters:
        config - The DiscoveryConfiguration to be used for discovery
        discoveryListener - The DiscoveryListener that should be notified whenever a set of Readers is found for connection.
        callback - The Callback that should be called after discover has completed.
        Returns:
        A Cancelable that allows the operation to be canceled at any time.

      • processPayment

        public void processPayment(PaymentIntent intent,
                           PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Processes a payment after collecting a payment method succeeds. === Synchronous capture === Stripe Terminal uses two-step card payments to prevent unintended and duplicate payments. When processPayment completes successfully, a charge has been authorized on the customer's card, but not yet been "captured". Your app must **synchronously notify your backend** to capture the PaymentIntent in order to settle the funds to your account. === Handling failures === When processPayment fails, the SDK returns an error that includes the updated PaymentIntent. Your app should inspect the updated PaymentIntent to decide how to retry the payment. 1. If the updated PaymentIntent is null, the request to Stripe's servers timed out and the PaymentIntent's status is unknown. We recommend that you retry processPayment with the original PaymentIntent. If you instead choose to abandon the original PaymentIntent and create a new one, **do not capture** the original PaymentIntent. If you do, you might charge your customer twice. 2. If the updated PaymentIntent's status is still REQUIRES_CONFIRMATION (e.g., the request failed because your app is not connected to the internet), you can call processPayment again with the updated PaymentIntent to retry the request. 3. If the updated PaymentIntent's status changes to REQUIRES_PAYMENT_METHOD (e.g., the request failed because the card was declined), call collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderDisplayListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) with the updated PaymentIntent to try charging another card. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments#process
        Parameters:
        intent - The PaymentIntent that should be processed
        callback - The PaymentIntentCallback to be called when processing completes

      • readReusableCard

        public Cancelable readReusableCard(ReadReusableCardParameters params,
                                   ReaderDisplayListener listener,
                                   PaymentMethodCallback callback)
        Reads a card with the given parameters and returns a PaymentMethod. **NOTE: Most integrations should **not** use readReusableCard.** You should create a PaymentIntent and use the associated collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderDisplayListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) and processPayment(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) methods if you are simply collecting a payment from a customer. You can use readReusableCard to read payment details and defer payment for later. The PaymentMethod created by this method will have type card, suitable for use with online payments. Note that if you use this method to defer a payment, the transaction will *not* receive the beneficial rates and liability shift associated with card present transactions. If reading a card fails, the callback will be called with an error containing details about the failure. If reading a card succeeds, the completion block will be called with a PaymentMethod. You should send the ID of the payment method to your backend for further processing. For example, you can use the fingerprint to look up charges created using the same card. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/online-payments
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters for reading the card.
        listener - Your listener for handling reader input events
        callback - The callback which will be called with a PaymentMethod when finished

      • retrievePaymentIntent

        public void retrievePaymentIntent(java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                  PaymentIntentCallback callback)
        Retrieves a PaymentIntent with a client secret. If the information required to create a PaymentIntent isn't readily available in your app, you can create the PaymentIntent on your server and use this method to retrieve the PaymentIntent in your app. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments#create
        Parameters:
        clientSecret - The client secret of the PaymentIntent to be retrieved
        callback - The callback to be called when retrieval completes

      • checkForUpdate

        public Cancelable checkForUpdate(ReaderSoftwareUpdateCallback callback)
        Checks for a reader update and prompts your app to begin installing the update. If an update is available, the callback will be called with a ReaderSoftwareUpdate object representing that update. If you want to install the update, pass it into installUpdate(com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderSoftwareUpdate, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderSoftwareUpdateListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.Callback). If no update is available, or an error occurs checking for an update, the callback will be called with an error.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be called when checking for an update completes.

      • installUpdate

        public Cancelable installUpdate(ReaderSoftwareUpdate update,
                                ReaderSoftwareUpdateListener listener,
                                Callback callback)
        Installs a specific update on the reader. When an update is initiated, the reader will become unresponsive until the update is complete. In some cases, you will need to restart the reader at the end of the update. As the update progresses, the listener's onReportReaderSoftwareUpdateProgress method will be called with a float representing how far along the update is. Use this to convey the update's progress to your user. Once the update has completed, the Callback will be called.
        Parameters:
        update - The update to be installed
        listener - The listener to notify as the update progresses
        callback - The callback that will be called upon completion or error

      • getConnectedReader

        public Reader getConnectedReader()
        Returns:
        The Reader that is currently connected or null if no reader is connected
